ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Very slow after DirectX 9 patch
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve got XP Pro with a 1.7 Celeron, 768 Ram and an ATI 9000 vid card (just 64 megs). Not the best set up, but it works well for me. I know if I had a better
ygData.messageBody:
I've got XP Pro with a 1.7 Celeron, 768 Ram and an ATI
9000 vid card (just 64 megs). Not the best set up, but
it works well for me. I know if I had a better vid
card, my lag would be even less, but I just don't have
the funds now, hehe.

I used to run Win ME and I lagged much worse then. So
yeah, it could be the OS.

--- Wulfric Rennison <wulftech@...> wrote:
> I honestly think a lot of it has to do with system
> specs. I dont know why they woudl be experiencing
> any lag with DX9 with a P4 processor. I run a P4
> 1.8Ghz with 1GB of RAM and a 128MB video card. I
> very rarely lag. Sometimes int he Bazaar when its
> crowded, and sometimes in POK when people are Mass
> Group Buffing. Other than that, it's quite smooth.
> And this is with Spell Particles turned on with full
> opacity and clip plane at 100%.
>
> I'm wondering if the person might be running Windows
> ME because I do know that I had a lot more lag when
> I ran EQ under WinME, but when I upgraded to Windows
> XP it seemed to work miracles for reducing lag.
> That's about the only thing I could see that may
> make a difference. I also have a 2nd PC which is
> relatively the same specs, except its a 1.6Ghz.
> Same thing still applies though. Very little lag.
>
> Maybe that's the difference? The OS you use?
>
> Raido Covenfall
> 55 ELF DRU
> Cazic Thule server
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Melanie Johnson
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Sent: Monday, March 29, 2004 12:52 PM
> Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: Very slow after
> DirectX 9 patch
>
>
> I've not been playing for a while now, but this
> has made me curious.
>
> I upgraded to DX9 last summer so I could play SWG.
> Then I started playing EQ again last fall, still
> using DX9. I didn't notice any difference, just my
> usual lag in PoK and the bazaar. So, is it the DX9
> that's messing everyone up, or some "upgrade" that
> SOE did to the graphic engine?
>
